title: Rolando Serrano
text:
José Rolando "Loco" Serrano Lazaro (born 13 November 1938 <a href="Pamplona%2C%20Colombia">Pamplona, Colombia</a>) was a Colombian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> midfielder.
Career.
Serrano helped the <a href="Colombia%20national%20football%20team">Colombia national football team</a> qualify for their first ever World Cup: <a href="1962%20FIFA%20World%20Cup">1962 FIFA World Cup</a>. The <a href="Colombia%20national%20football%20team">Colombia national football team</a> lost both their first and third group stage matches, but drew the <a href="Soviet%20Union%20national%20football%20team">Soviet Union team</a> under <a href="1960%20European%20Nations%27%20Cup">1960 European Football Championship</a> winning coach <a href="Gavriil%20Kachalin">Gavriil Kachalin</a>. He also competed for Colombia in the <a href="1963%20South%20American%20Championship">1963 South American Championship</a>.
After retiring from playing, Serrano was appointed the manager of local club Cúcuta Deportivo in January 1982.
